ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was
What is your overall assessment of this course
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I was able to better analyze individual artworks, and how they fit into a larger tradition of art. I also learned how to think comparatively about art from different civilizations.

Skills in reading art historical texts, looking closely at artworks, writing descriptively and analytically about artworks, and discussing historical trends  in class. 

Knowledge of art historical themes and evolutions across regions from Prehistory to Renaissance.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The comparative aspect of the course was very interesting, and I appreciate it. I would have liked a little more feedback on the looking diaries and tips on how to improve those assignments, but the feedback from the midterm exam was very helpful for the final.
Discussions are a little long. Lectures are very interesting and engaging.

This course was interesting, fun, and challenging.  All survey courses face the problem of compressing long time periods into a few class meetings.  Summer courses are even more compressed.  It would have been nice to meet in person and look at artworks together, in real time.  However, the online-format was well-managed.  There was small group work, lectures, and in-class discussion.  There were many opportunities to write about art works and receive meaningful feedback from the instructor.  The readings were well chosen and interesting. The course required a lot of work, but not so much that it was impossible to read closely.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Definitely! Even though Professor Coyle went through thousands of years of history, I still felt like I grasped the main concepts from various civilizations, which will help me choose what more specialized courses to take in the future.
Yes. It is a great introduction course.
Yes.  The artworks and readings were interesting.
